root.title: 3-4 Bichiktoo-Bum II
root.place: Inscriptions found in south district of village Bichiktoo-Bum in Onguday region. The fragments of stone brought to Gorno-Altaisk in 1970s.
root.store: Stored in The National Museum of Altai Republic named after Anochin. Inv #№ 10354/1 and 10354/2.
root.general: The text is on thin slate plate. Index in «Drevnetjurkskii slovar» 526 - A8. Marked as Bichiktoo-Bum II/1, Bichiktoo-Bum II/2 in scientific investigations.
root.description: Two lines of text are on Bichiktoo-Bum II/1. The top line consists 6, the bottom line consists 5 signs. There is only one line on Bichiktoo-Bum II/2 consisting of 9 signs.
root.size: Bichiktoo-Bum II/1: the length of top line – 7.4 cm, the bottom line – 6 cm. Bichiktoo-Bum II/2: the length of line 9 см; the height of signs – 2-2.5 cm.
root.investigation: Found in late 1950s. Seydakmatov investigated on found place in 1964 524. Tenishev, Vasilyiev, Surazakov, Kyzlasov 525, Kocheev 523 conducted investigations. Seydakmatov, Tenishev and Kyzlasov studied the text. Translation of the top line by Kyzlasov: "(Мой бог) предстань перед грешным мужем. (Это я написал) – (My god) appear before sinful man. (I wrote this)". Translation of the bottom line by Kyzlasov: "(И) твоему сыну человеческому (явись) – (And) to your human son (come down)".
